text: Alan John Phillips (born 21 August 1954) is a former international rugby union player. A hooker, he played his club rugby for Cardiff RFC his modern game of forward play being so impressive that Cardiff selectors played him straight out of youth rugby (Kenfig Hill RFC). Phillips scored 162 tries in 481 appearances for Cardiff RFC. He toured South Africa with the British and Irish Lions in 1980 and was in the Wales squad for the 1987 Rugby World Cup. He won 18 caps for Wales between 1979 - 1987. Phillips has been Wales Team Manager since the Autumn of 2002, winning 3 Grand Slams as Team Manager (2005, 2008 & 2012). ==References== Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:Welsh rugby union players Category:Wales international rugby union players Category:Welsh rugby union coaches Category:British and Irish Lions rugby union players from Wales Category:Rugby union hookers Category:Cardiff RFC players
title: Alan Phillips (rugby)
